model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: What position did you play, when you played soccer in college?

[MEMORY]
User Description:
Speaker B is a 26-year-old law clerk who works 12 hours a day and wishes to be back in college. They are a Black Sabbath junkie with a background in Humanities and now working at a law firm. Speaker B would rather be a film reviewer and is in debt despite working hard.

Relationship Description:
Speaker B shows interest in discussing career prospects with Speaker A, who loves playing soccer. Speaker A asked Speaker B to connect with their neighbor Cynthia, who works as a human resources specialist. Speaker B will text Cynthia's number to Speaker A later. Speaker B accidentally responded to Speaker A due to a spider landing on their keyboard, revealing their fear of spiders. Speaker A also has arachnophobia.

Event Description:
Speaker A and Speaker B shared a conversation about career paths and humanities. Speaker B recommended a guidance counselor to Speaker A. Speaker A has a soccer tournament coming up and loves Arsenal. Speaker B enjoys researching and writing briefs for their job at the law firm. Speaker B was once pranked with a spider by their boss at work and is considering asking for a raise. Speaker B likes Manchester United.
